byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

abstract: Former Florida Gov Jeb Bush's bid for Republican presidential nomination in 2016 raises question of what kind of candidate's spouse his wife Columba Bush will be; she has largely avoided politics and the public eye since marrying into the political dynasty, and her search for an ordinary life has often been in conflict with her husband's political ambitions.
lead_paragraph: As Columba Bush wrestled with whether to support her husband, Jeb Bush, if he decided to run for president, her sense of duty was mixed with dread.

headline.main: Bush Spouse Backs Jeb, but Is Wary of Family Business
headline.print_headline: A Bush Outsider, Backing Jeb but Wary of Family Business

snippet: As Columba Bush wrestled with whether to support her husband, Jeb Bush, if he decided to run for president, her sense of duty was mixed with dread.
